column3: utACK. I wonder how much impact this will have on transaction relay speed/cost, but probably not much, as it should use signature caching.\n
@sipa Yeah, the signature cache is used here.\n
Yeah, should be. This is certainly a safe defense.\n
I think this patch should be included in `0.10`.\n

Probably naive reasoning, but as STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS is defined as a superset of MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS

``` c++
static const unsigned int STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS = MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS |
    SCRIPT_VERIFY_STRICTENC |
    ...
```

...doesn't that mean that we already check against a stricter check before we even get there?
Is this a precaution against bugs wh
@laanwj Indeed. Note that until recently, not all script evaluation flags were actually strengthenings. Belt-and-suspenders.\n
